009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.QRDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements line fitting by orthogonal regression to a set of 2D
023 * points by solving a homogeneous linear system. See Sec. 6.7.1 of [1] and Sec.
024 * 10.2.2 (Alg. 10.2) of [2] for additional details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Gander, M. J. Gander, and F. Kwok. “Scientific Computing – An
028 * Introduction using Maple and MATLAB”. Springer (2014). <br>
029 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
030 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2022/09/29
035 * 
036 * @see OrthogonalLineFitEigen
037 * @see OrthogonalLineFitSvd
038 */
039public class OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous implements LineFit {
040        
041        private final Pnt2d[] points;
042        private final double[] p;       // algebraic line parameters A,B,C
043        
044        public OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous(Pnt2d[] points) {
045                if (points.length < 2) {
046                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
047                }
048                this.points = points;
049                this.p = fit();
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public int getSize() {
054                return points.length;
055        }
056        
057        @Override
058        public double[] getLineParameters() {
059                return p;
060        }
061        
062        private double[] fit() {
063                final int n = points.length; //.max(3, pts.length);
064                final double[][] X = new double[n][3];
065                
066                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
067                        X[i][0] = 1;
068                        X[i][1] = points[i].getX();
069                        X[i][2] = points[i].getY();
070                }
071                
072                QRDecomposition qr = new QRDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(X));
073                RealMatrix R = qr.getR();
074                
075//              RealMatrix RR = R.getSubMatrix(1, 2, 1, 2);
076                RealMatrix RR = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(2,2);
077                RR.setEntry(0, 0, R.getEntry(1, 1));
078                RR.setEntry(0, 1, R.getEntry(1, 2));
079                if (R.getRowDimension() >= 3) {
080                        RR.setEntry(1, 1, R.getEntry(2, 2));
081                }
082        
083                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(RR);
084                
085                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
086                double[] s = svd.getSingularValues();
087                int k = Matrix.idxMin(s);
088                double[] e = V.getColumn(k);
089                
090                double R01 = R.getEntry(0, 1);
091                double R02 = R.getEntry(0, 2);
092                double R00 = R.getEntry(0, 0);
093
094                double A = e[0];
095                double B = e[1];
096                double C = ( -A * R01 - B * R02) / R00;
097                return new double[] {A,B,C};
098        }
099
100}
